Key Match Events: Phil Salt reaches fifty off 38 balls
West Indies set a target of 181 runs
England win the match with 15 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies get a bloody nose and will need wins to go through – with USA and South Africa awaiting both teams.
England win the toss and will bowl!
West Indies revert to their strongest side from the first round.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell: “I think we left 15-20 runs out there as a batting group but we could give a better display as a bowling group too. Yea we’re normally very good in the last final overs but credit to the England team, it is just for us to revealuate.”

Jos Buttler: “I thought it was a really good performance from us, we executed really well with the bat and ball. I thought we bowled really well to restrict such a powerful batting line up, and I thought we were very smart with the bat, Jonny came in with great intent and Salt tucked in behind him for a bit and then … went big. [Something positive I didn’t catch about Archer]…Adil Rashid, we keep saying he’s our most important players, so much variation in taking wickets and restricting runs. I thought today was a really mature senior player innings by Bairstow.”

Phil Salt: “Not looking too far ahead at the minute,” says Salt, “just looking at a good team win. it was a bit tougher in the middle against the spin. I’ve got to back myself to cash in agains the seamers.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies compile 180 runs in their Super Eight match at the T20 World Cup
England’s Moeen Ali dives to make his ground on a second run against West Indies at the T20 World Cup
West Indies captain Rovman Powell suffers a side strain and will not return to the field of play today
England captain Jos Buttler calls correctly on what looks like a steamy St Lucia night
England win the toss and elect to field
Others: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
The match is played in a cricket ground named after the coach of one of the competing teams
The match is played in a cricket ground with a stand named after one of the competing players
